of.translation[0].definitions[0].definit: used to show what a part belongs to or comes from
of.translation[0].definitions[0].example: the last scene of the movie
of.translation[0].definitions[1].definit: used to show who something or someone belongs to or has a connection with
of.translation[0].definitions[1].example: Avocado salad is a favourite of mine.
Product inspection is the responsibility of the employees themselves.
of.translation[0].definitions[2].definit: used when talking about a feature or quality that something has
of.translation[0].definitions[2].example: the length of the swimming pool
of.translation[0].definitions[3].definit: used to show what group one or more things or people belong to
of.translation[0].definitions[3].example: ‘Sunflowers’ is one of his best-known paintings.
Two of the guests are vegetarian.
a member of the baseball team
of.translation[0].definitions[4].definit: used to show what type of substance or thing you are referring to, when talking about an amount
of.translation[0].definitions[5].definit: used to say what something contains
of.translation[0].definitions[6].definit: used to say what type of things or people are in a group
of.translation[0].definitions[7].definit: used to state specifically which thing of the general type mentioned you are referring to
of.translation[0].definitions[8].definit: used to state specifically what a particular number, amount, age etc is
of.translation[0].definitions[9].definit: used to talk about things produced by a famous or skilled writer, artist etc
of.translation[0].definitions[9].example: the work of a great architect
of.translation[0].definitions[10].defini: used to say what a story, some news etc is about, or what a picture, map etc shows
of.translation[0].definitions[10].exampl: a story of love and loss
of.translation[0].definitions[11].defini: used after nouns that refer to actions, or to people who do something, in order to show who or what the action is done to
of.translation[0].definitions[12].defini: used after nouns that refer to actions in order to show who or what does the action
of.translation[0].definitions[13].defini: used after some adjectives that describe feelings, to show who or what the feeling is directed towards
of.translation[0].definitions[13].exampl: He’s always been frightened of spiders.
Most children want their parents to feel proud of them.
of.translation[0].definitions[14].defini: used when referring to the day, moment etc when something happened
of.translation[0].definitions[14].exampl: I was at home at the time of the murder.
of.translation[0].definitions[15].defini: used to say where something is in relation to a place or thing
of.translation[0].definitions[15].exampl: I live within a mile of here.
a historic seaside town 99 km south of London
To the left of the sofa is a table.
of.translation[0].definitions[16].defini: used to describe a person or thing by saying what their main qualities or features are
of.translation[0].definitions[16].exampl: Albright was seen as a woman of great determination.
It’s an area of considerable historical interest.
of.translation[0].definitions[17].defini: used to say what someone’s age is
of.translation[0].definitions[17].exampl: He has two children, a boy of 12 and a girl of 15.
of.translation[0].definitions[18].defini: used to say where someone comes from
of.translation[0].definitions[19].defini: used to show the country, organization, or group in which someone has a particular position
of.translation[0].definitions[19].exampl: the secretary of the tennis club
of.translation[0].definitions[20].defini: used in dates before the name of the month
of.translation[0].definitions[21].defini: used to say when something happened
of.translation[0].definitions[21].exampl: one of the biggest upsets of recent years
of.translation[0].definitions[22].defini: used in giving the time, to mean ‘before’
of.translation[0].definitions[23].defini: used to show the cause of someone’s death
of.translation[0].definitions[24].defini: used to say what material has been used to make something
of.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: GRAMMAR: Possessives
of.translation[0].note_box[0].items[0].e: The usual way to say that something belongs to someone, or that someone is connected with someone, is by using -’s You say
of.translation[0].note_box[0].items[1].e: You use –s’ after a plural noun ending in ‘s’
of.translation[0].note_box[0].items[2].e: You use of mine/yours/his/hers/ours/theirs when talking about one of several people or things belonging to or connected with someone
of.translation[0].note_box[0].items[3].e: You use by when saying who sang, wrote, or painted something
